questions.question: 1. A positive edge-triggered D flip-flop is connected to a positive edge-triggered J K flip-flop. The Q output of the D flip-flop is connected to both the J and K inputs of the J K flip-flop, while the Q output of the J K flip-flop is connected to the input of the D flip-flop. At first, the output of a D flip-flop is set to logic one, and the output of the JK flip-flop is cleared. Which one of the following options is the bit sequence generated at the Q output of the JK flip-flop when the flip-flops are connected to a free-running standard clock? Consider that J = K = 1 is the toggle mode and J = K = 0 is the state-holding mode of the JK flip-flop. Both the flip-flops have non-zero propagation delays.

explanations.a: J and K are required to be set to 1 thereby converting the J-K flip-flops to T flip-flops

questions.question: 2. A four-bit Johnson counter with an initial value of (0000). The sequence of counting is:-

explanations.c: In general in an n-bit asynchronous basic binary counter, only the first flip flop's clk input is connected to Clock, clocks of all other flip flops are connected to Q of the previous flip flop

questions.question: 3. The number of pulses is needed to change the contents of an 8-bit up-counter from 10101100 to 00100111 (the rightmost bit is the LSB)?

explanations.c: Number of states = number of flip flops for a ring counter as at a given time only one flip flop can have the value 1

questions.question: 4. To design a synchronous counter having sequence ( 0-1-0-2-0-3 ) and then repeats. To implement this counter is the minimum number of J-K flip-flops required. Note: This question was asked as a Numerical Answer Type.

explanations.c: Number of possible states = 2^(number of flip flops) for a basic counter. So number of flip flops = log2(number of possible states)
